website_summaries.verdict: A top option for a lightweight stroller that can be used for travel or everyday use. Easy to open and fold, and can be steered with one hand.
pros: We like the storage capacity of the basket on this model, as well as the fact that is stands on its own when closed
It offers impressive maneuvering for a lightweight stroller, and reclines slightly for baby's comfort
cons: This offers more limited seating positions
It reclines slightly, and can be changed to recline more, but it doesn't offer a fully upright or fully laying down position

website_summaries.verdict: A good lightweight stroller at a reasonable price. If you need ample storage space, this is the stroller to get.
pros: and folds down to 16" for easy portability

website_summaries.verdict: Owners are dazzled by its quality, durability, and low price.
pros: Rugged, compact, and designed for outdoor use
cons: We wish this stroller came with a locking mechanism to keep it from opening unexpectedly when folded

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works great and light weight so this Grandma can lift it and store it in the car
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Huntsinger

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say that this stroller has been my saving grace with my very rambunctious toddler son. I purchased this stroller when he turned 2 and now he is still riding comfortably at 3 years old and 40 inches tall. We go on long walks frequently, charity walks for miles with the stroller. It is very light weight and not bulky at all best of all:) August 5, 2018 My son is almost 4 and we go for long walks every day. He is approximately 40 lbs and nearly 44 inches tall.
customer_reviews.author: Soulofdreams

customer_reviews.title: Its light and have everything but
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's very light and compact. Almost have everything you are looking in a stroller - kids tray .. parents tray, underneath storage, quick fold, lightweight. But one thing I faced with this stroller is wobbling of tites even if I just walk fast not running obviously I know that its not a jogger, the tires starts wobbling very badly almost looking like it will fall apart in pieces. I don't know whether it's just a case with me or is it common with this model. I do purchased like new open box from Amazon instead of new. So maybe it was not good at the first place if it was returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: heer

customer_reviews.title: Horribly flawed
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst. 1) the “shocks” On the front wheels do absolutely nothing. 2) The “all-terrain “tires are plastic and make for a very bumpy ride. Because they are advertised all-terrain I was expecting something more rubberized. 3) the sun shade SUCKS. It is not movable so I can’t cover the front of baby if we’re facing the sun. If we’re not facing the sun, baby It’s completely unprotected from the back, due to the fact that the back is made of netting. No matter which direction he’s facing, baby is completely in the sunlight
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: This stroller put up with constant use over rough cobblestone and surprisingly the shocks are still in good shape. The small basket held more than we ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stroller for a month long trip to Europe. This stroller put up with constant use over rough cobblestone and surprisingly the shocks are still in good shape. The small basket held more than we thought it would, although if you stuff it, it is hard to pull things out. We utilized the reclining seat when my daughter would nap while we were out and she seemed really comfortable. The only downside is that the cup holders were small, so it wouldn't hold my reusable bottle. Although I'm happy that it has a cup holder at all. All in all this stroller was a lifesaver and is still being put to good use back at home.
customer_reviews.author: michael pinheiro

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight stroller ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller traveled with us all through Europe. Uneven terrain, curbs, nothing was an issue for the miles we walked every day. This stroller came everywhere with us..on planes, boats, trains, and cars and it was easy to fold and unfold and light to carry. We have many pricier strollers but this one ranks right up there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We had the Jeep stroller which was exactly like this (I think from the previous manufacturer) and it ...
customer_reviews.text: We had the Jeep stroller which was exactly like this (I think from the previous manufacturer) and it was great! It could bear many flights, beach, the roughest sidewalks... when we had to replace it we chose this one because we thought it was the same... No! it got broken immediately, the fabric, the handle, all the material is so low quality! We had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money... keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Bad stroller.... 1) feels cheap, 2) does not stay folded, 3) cup holders too small to fit most sippy cups, 4) requires more power to push around, 5) opening in canopy does not have a cover, thus when the sun is behind you, it shines straight on toddler's head, 6) tray is not easily removable, thus putting in and taking out child requires extra effort, 6) harness is way too short and tight, even on the loose setting ... only good thing is the storage basket which is large and easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: crm17

customer_reviews.title: No mid-section support for the babes!
customer_reviews.text: The stroller serves it's purpose in being lightweight and easy to travel with but...after using a few days on our family vacation the wheels are severely warped and chewed up from debris on the sidewalks and road. The biggest issue is that my daughter has no support for her mid-section. She slides down in the seat constantly. wish it would have better support for her and the straps are basic garbage. I would keep this in mind if you decide to purchase this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I regret buying this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying this stroller. There is almost no under carriage storage. I can barely squeeze my diaper bag under the stroller, and once it’s stuffed in, I cannot easily get it out. Also, the cup holders are a joke. They are too small to hold a water bottle, a baby bottle or a child’s snack cup. Honestly, I’ve not found anything that will fit in the cup holders. Overall, I wish I had researched this stroll more before buying because it does not meet my needs of taking my 1-year old out places and having storage for all of the stuff that hours along with a baby.
customer_reviews.author: KTD

customer_reviews.title: Stroller is Okay. Good buy if you are on a budget. Not comfortable for Baby.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea that this stroller is lightweight. I also love the idea that it is a cost effective alternative to the more expensive strollers. The one drawback, and the reason that this stroller doesn't cost more is the fact that it is not comfortable for babies. Babies cannot sit upright with support to their backs. For laying down or laying back, the stroller is fine, but sitting upright is a problem. Baby is going to be uncomfortable sitting upright. Other than that, the stroller is fine. Wheels are a really cheap plastic though, so beware.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: It is SUPER lightweight and folds down nicely
customer_reviews.text: We also have a Bob stroller, but purchased this for a trip to St. Maarten this winter since it's much more compact than the Bob. It is SUPER lightweight and folds down nicely. Our little guy really seemed to like it from a comfort standpoint. The front turning wheels, however, get stuck sometimes when I do wheelies for him and skid a bit upon landing. The foot rest is adjustable, but just kept falling to its lowest position also. I'd recommend it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DaBanny

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky wheel after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: First off very easy assembly. I purchased this to replace an older stroller we loved but outgrew it. This is perfect if you are looking for a light weight stroller that doesn't take up much trunk space for our Hyundai Elantra as well as something with decent storage. I was able to take this on a couple different surfaces such as gravel, sidewalk, dirt, and pavement it rode wonderfully I have no doubt it'll do fine in the snow. Plenty of storage in the bottom for diaper bag and shopping bags. Update I've had this for about a month and the left wheel is now squeaky after about 5th use. So that's disappointing and annoying
customer_reviews.author: Smurphs1

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING in every way!!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is AMAZING for everything, but especially travel!! It’s really lightweight which is great since you cannot take strollers that are over 11 lbs through security. I traveled with a toddler and this stroller was a LIFESAVER! It was so easy to fold up that I didn’t take my son out until I was at the airplane door. Also, we took the stroller to the beach and it rolled so smoothly and sand did not stick to the wheels! I have tried many strollers, but this is by far the BEST!!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Fyfe

customer_reviews.title: Major letdown
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this stroller and it seemed perfect. The back support is not terrific for the child but not the worst. I am writing this review because I got on to see if I could return it. After five months the "easy" one-hand close function no longer functions. I can't collapse the stroller. I'm really frustrated with it because I bought it to be in my van for when I go places. If you're on the fence about this stroller buy a different one and pass on this one. It doesn't hold up and I'm very easy on strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the fairly cheap price. Bought it for my 6.5 month old and it did not support him adequately (the seat bucket is not deep/slanted enough). Would have returned it but my husband threw the packaging away. The harness is very dinky and the seat, sides, and back have no padding. My baby looks horribly uncomfortable and slouchy in it. I keep hoping as he grows it will work better for him, but at 9 months, his positioning is only slightly improved. Haven't used it once. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sundhari

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my toddlers Disney trip. It worked great. It did take me some practice to open/close it, but once you get the hang, it’s super easy! I have a more expensive umbrella stroller and I like this one better for the trays. They are very practical and worked great during our trip. I like the handle a lot as well. The only downside for me is that it doesn’t recline much. After the Disney trip. We took an international trip and it survived being tossed around. I am really happy with this and if it ever breaks I will get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Sookie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for in a "grandparent" stroller! Great value for the price. I didn't want a flimsy umbrella stroller, but had no need for a big expensive full size since it's only needed occasionally. I love how lightweight and easy to maneuver it is.
customer_reviews.author: Barb P

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller for a trip to Georgia with my son. We wanted something that was easy to travel with, but wasn't as flimsy as an umbrella stroller, and something that had a tray and reclined for snacks and naps on the go. This was the perfect solution. Easy to fold, smooth riding wheels, and the handle was tall enough (I'm 6'3"). The only complaint is that its a bit bulky and takes up a lot of room in the trunk. But the benefits far outweigh this minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R Mister

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller to keep at our vacation home. The stroller was very easy to setup. I personally couldn’t fold it with one hand, I’m petite with small hands and just couldn’t. The only things I don’t like about the stroller are that the peep hole doesn’t have a flap to cover it to prevent weather from getting onto the baby/child (see pictures) and I wish the back could sit up a little higher but it seems to be okay enough. Other than that it truly is lightweight and a good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.text: Received the product today and what can I say? It's a great stroller, it's well made but yet it's light enough for my petite wife to pick up. I was skeptical going from a three wheeled jogger to this stroller as I felt that it would not maneuver so easily. But this stroller maneuver is very easily and is very easy to assemble. It's got great storage. My son is 2 and is very tall for his age and this stroller fits him very well. The only downfall is the front cup holder does not swing to one side allowing the child to get into stroller by himself. But at this price I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gent

customer_reviews.title: Great price.Lightweight.QUICK&EASY assembly
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the easiest assembly I've ever had to do for any baby product so far. No tools necessary, everything just clicks into place. It might have taken me 10 minutes at most. It's super lightweight. I love that it has a tray table for both baby and Mom or Dad. And the main feature that sold me (besides the price) was the weight capacity. Unfortunately my two year old outgrew the cheapo single stroller I had bought for her so the 50 lb capacity on this Kolcraft one should last us a while. And even though I really didn't want to have to spend anymore money on strollers, this was definitely $50 well spent.
customer_reviews.author: NYer523

customer_reviews.title: A nice stroller for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Great little travel stroller, I use this a lot, it definitely holds up with travel and has a lot of amenities, but I will say it is hard to fold until you learn how to line up the wheels just right, after that it’s easier. The cup holders are so small I don’t own anything that fits in it, mostly I use it to hold my keys. The storage is nice, although my diaper bag BARELY fits and once it’s in there nothing else can fit. So don’t buy it expecting an umbrella stroller with full stroller amenities, it’s still just an umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Potter

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our international trip for my son. Worked like a charm. Very light weight, easy to open and close and took a lot of beatings. If your real tall like my husband it might have you slump over a little to push but not to bad. When we take walks around the neighnorhood we take this and sometime our little dog rides at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: STap

customer_reviews.title: Great travel lightweight stroller that reclines
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson or should I say his mommy and daddy to use on their Walt Disney world vacation trip! It’s very lightweight and folds easy and my daughter-in-law and I put it together in about five minutes! We got caught up on the front wheel part so we just watched a YouTube how to video!! 😊 Every picture/video that my daughter-in-law posts while on vacation shows my grandson in that carriage everywhere! There’s a cupholder for the child and there’s cupholders on the top part for the parents and there’s a little compartment underneath which is great to have! I chose this one because it reclines in case my grandson falls asleep!
customer_reviews.author: Mariapal7

customer_reviews.title: Hard No!
customer_reviews.text: Stroller broke in less than a week. The mechanism on the handle to collapse the stroller broke leaving us unable to collapse it. When we could collapse it the latch to hold it shut had nowhere to hook so it always popped open. The front wheels would also get in the way when collapsing. Lastly, the cup holders are so small they're virtually useless. I have no clue how this stroller had such good reviews, it is flawed in so many ways.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is not suitable for toddlers or people over 5'4 (my height - hubs is 6'2 and it's far too short) my 3 slender year old looks stuffed into this stroller and he can't put his feet on the door test without removing the tray.... Otherwise he get dragv on the ground. Also the adult yay up top will not click into place at all (the tray is warped out of the box) I'm dissatisfied and disappointed - I regret buying this stroller and am not happy that I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzybird6

customer_reviews.title: Great little stroller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller for walks with my grandson and it's working out great. Very easy to open and close - in fact I can do it with one hand while holding him with the other. It's very light and I can easily lift it in and out of the car trunk. It's much easier for me to maneuver than his full-sized stroller and I've had no trouble pushing it, even on short gravel pathways. My only complaint is the cup holders are too small (diameter) to hold any of my cups. They're more sized to fit a slim water bottle, but there is plenty of room in the basket for a purse, diaper bag, etc. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Ruble

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Some issues getting it folded back down from open. The front wheels don't fit well when it's folded. It tends to pop open when I'm pulling it out of the back of my car without me pressing the release button on the handle. Love that it's the perfect cross between the larger strollers and an umbrella stroller. The compartment underneath is a great size. It's light weight and generally well made. The tray is a bit cumbersome - doesn't swing open to allow for easy removal of my kiddo; has to be completely removed to take him out. It just pops off though, so not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fairly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am fairly disappointed in this strolled. I don't find it very easy to collapse or open one handed or even with two. The wheels have to be lined up just so in order for it to collapse all the way. The wheels do not seem durable for use on poorly maintained sidewalks. It also has a fairly large profile when collapsed, which was surprising. That being said, my daughter seems comfortable in it, it is lighter than our last stroller and the little tray in front is great. The storage area beneath the stroller is also very roomy. Depending on what you need it for, it could be perfect for you or something to pass on.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Some good points...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold and it’s lightweight BUT, it is always in a slightly reclining position and if you’re walking a curious 8-month-old in a mall or populated place (zoo, park, etc.), I find that he gets frustrated trying to sit up and look around. Another feature is that the seat is short ( from back to front) and tilts down a little. The positives are that it is really easy to take in and out of the car and has good maneuverability. I am going to see if I can make him a thin wedge that I can put behind his back so he can sit up a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, BUT..
customer_reviews.text: This stroller was excellent for travel. We have a jogger as well. We got this one for our family Disney trip. It was nice because the folding was East, it was lightweight as described, and it had a small storage at bottom. My only con was that it did not fit most sippy cups. The cup holders were too small. I do wish the storage compartment at bottom was larger. Also, my 2yo is on the taller side. She was uncomfortable in this because there was not enough leg room. The footrest was at the lowest position and she still was too tall.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhhh
customer_reviews.text: So I bought it thinking it would be so easy to fold up for traveling in the car - plus being light weight. Well, it's impossible to fold up because the wheels have to be JUST RIGHT in order to do so. It's a pain in the neck. Then the back is ALWAYS at a slant - I can't fix it so my grandson is sitting up straight - so he hates it. The strap at the back that is suppose to allow you to set the back at different angles doesn't hold. I don't bother using it any more. Waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: JIP

customer_reviews.title: Nice light weight stroller
customer_reviews.text: Stroller came quickly. It was very easy to put together. Took me maybe 20 minutes. It is very easy to maneuver, it takes a little effort to fold. Overall I like it. We bought it for an upcoming trip. It is very light and compact, which I was looking for. Took one star off because stroller came with some stains on the bottom of the seat. By the time I saw them I already put it together and didn't want to deal with return. So I kept it. When my toddler seats in the stroller you can't see it, so it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have to put this together and no instructions are included plus it is missing a wheel cover. Debating on returning but this grandmother will have to get it to the car in the box! I did return this. I do not believe this was a product defect but a mess up on Amazon. They very seldom mess up.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this stroller since I loved my last kolcraft but good grief it is a lemon. It doesn't fold nicely and is always a struggle to get it to fold flat. One of the clips on the harness just unhook randomly. The front tires have never worked well but now they are squealing. I am half tempted to toss it but really need something until I get a replacement. I love the color and thats about it. Don't buy this stroller, you will regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Trussell

customer_reviews.title: Came incomplete, NOT one handed folding
customer_reviews.text: This came without all the parts so I returned it. Also, I ordered it because my husband has limited use of his right hand. This was *NOT* one handed folding. I had to use two hands and my knee. We will just stick with our Britax. It’s so much bigger but you can easily fold with one hand while still holding the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Wenning

customer_reviews.title: My toddler loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stroller for a great price! My son is two years old so I needed a toddler stroller & this is it. It has a cup holder & snack holder for parent & baby, it has the mesh to hold stuff in the bottom of the stroller, sun protection, and lays back not all the way flat but enough for him to sleep. Super easy to fold & maneuver! Very lightweight and compatible , I took it to Disney and didn’t have a hard time passing through the crowds like I usually do with a bigger stroller! Love it! Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.author: Isis

customer_reviews.title: It a fine stroller for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality stroller . The positives are : 1. It maneuvers well 2. Sturdy 3. Hasn’t torn; it’s held up after months of use 4. Great price There are negatives though . 1. It doesn’t recline all the way back so it’s not good for a napping toddler 2. Its not the easiest to fold and it doesn’t fold all the way down 3. The canopy doesn’t provide any real shade 4. The cup holders are too small for standard cups or bottles
customer_reviews.author: Yzamara Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller feels cheap, BUT it pushes comfortably and hits all of the points I was looking for: one hand push, easy fold, lightweight, kid tray, cupholder(s), canopy, and recline. The easily accessible storage was just a pleasant extra! On the con side: the recline isn’t very deep, the kid tray doesn’t swing open and closed (so placing a larger child in the stroller may be tricky), and again, it’s a cheap plastic (lightweight!) stroller, that is just fine for pushing around town, malls, amusement parks, etc. and folds up pretty flat for public transit or the back of your car.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Compact and inexpensive stroller
customer_reviews.text: I got this stroller because I had a combo one with a baby carrier which my son outgrew. The stroller was a bit bulky so I ended up selling that one and was looking for a more compact and inexpensive one to replace it. This was the perfect option for me and it did not cost much at all which is even better! It takes up far less space in my trunk so I can finally start putting groceries in there again.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Whitebread

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is very cheaply made. Do NOT waste your money. The only good thing about this stroller is that it is light weight. The basket is much small, the seat is angled and even with the seat leaned all the way back which it doesn't lean back much at all it still sits forward too much and the child will fall out if you stop too suddenly without harness on on the tray on. The shocks are just cheap plastic. It does not easily fold at all and you can not push it after it is folded. You must basically drag it. Overall a terrible waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Summerlot

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to fold. Major win for air travel
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for traveling instead of bringing the big clunky 5,000lb stroller we own. This one is very lightweight and easy to fold. My son is pretty picky about the angle he sits in a stroller (he’s weird I know) but he seemed to love this one! I love the toddler tray on the front, it came in very useful while strolling through the airport. Because it’s so lightweight it’s made of cheaper feeling material which isn’t a big deal but the plane workers throw that stuff around and somehow the locking latch got broken. It’s not a big deal and certainly not this companies fault just be warned, it does seem like it could break easily.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Wessels

customer_reviews.title: Not Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The stroller was super easy to assemble (and light), however it isn’t very comfortable for my daughter. The seat is strange. I can’t figure it out, but it’s hard for my daughter to not slide forward. She’s harnessed in, yet still slides and because there is no comfort guard for the harness buckles, it just digs into her diaper causing a wedgie-like situation. She doesn’t like to sit in for long... it’s unfortunate. Also, the cup holder holes at the top are too tiny to hold a cup. So even though it’s nice in theory, they are completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: STUFFILOVE

customer_reviews.title: Really convenient and light weight stroller!
customer_reviews.text: We have had purchased this stroller in December 2017 for Christmas vacation and knew we would be traveling from airport to airport. This is just the stroller we needed to get through the airport and especially helpful going through security. I was able to fold this stroller down while holding my 15 month old in one arm. This does fold down to fit through the X-ray system. The only things that I wish were bigger in this are the cup holders and the storage basket below but these can work since it IS a smaller lightweight stroller. Overall this was a great find and continue using this on regular outings.
customer_reviews.author: Tristin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product | Tiny Cup Holders
customer_reviews.text: As long as you don't need a cup holder, this is a great product. It's very lightweight, it folds up so easily, and baby rides comfortably. The cup holders are veeeeery small. You might be able to fit a White Claw or a slim fit can, but nothing else. The stroller seat back height can be adjusted. It uses a strap, so you either tighten it to raise it, or lessen it to lean it back. It does not recline all the way. Other than the weird quirks, it's been a lifesaver and a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Under neath storage is good, and easy to access
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month looks UNCOMFORTABLE. The back can not be adjusted for the occupant to sit up straight so what happens... my tot slouches as we stroll forward causing the center strap that holds her in to ride right on her privates. Lightweight- Yes. Under neath storage is good, and easy to access. The hand folding doesn't work for me or my hubby.
customer_reviews.author: brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, with a couple of cons.
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this prior to a flight, I did a lot of research and read many reviews. This is a decent travel stroller for the price. And it is very possible to open and close with one hand. It also can stand on its own in the folded position. My kid does seem to be sliding down towards the front of the stroller most of the time, however. And when folded, the little swing latch to hold it folded is too long for how well it can compact, so it won’t lock into place. Otherwise it has been a good purchase and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Damian D

customer_reviews.title: Baby slides down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller to use as a lightweight stroller for my 1 year old. After trying it a few times, the back doesn't sit up 90 degrees like I originally thought and she is constantly sliding down in it. The seat is awkward and isn't very comfortable for her. Also, my husband who is just under 6ft tall has to slightly bend to push it...so not good for taller people. I wish I could return this but after putting it together, it would be too much work to take apart and repack. Its disappointing for sure.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap stroller I could use for our season passes to Universal Studios for my 5 year old. She meets the weight limits for this stroller but the seat is pretty short. It does it's job though. I actually love pushing her in this stroller because it moves and turns so good, even with a 40 something pound kid sitting in it. And it is super light. Folding it is easy but sometimes it seems to get stuck and won't fold all the way in. Not a huge issue for me because the ease of pushing her in it makes any less favorable issue seem like nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Lover of turtles❤️

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller for vacation and so far we’re happy with it. If you don’t lock the little lever when you fold it up it does pop open which is annoying, but fixable... The front wheel has been squeaking lately but it likely just needs to be greased. I have found that the “Take and Toss” spill-proof straw cups DO fit in the snack tray cup holder, but no others that I’ve tried so far.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Good for a lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: This is SO easy to maneuver!! Holy cow! We took it to the zoo today and I could steer it around with one hand! I've never had such a smooth stroller. I bumped off a star because I really really wish there was more seat for them to sit on. There's barely any space there--it doesn't seem comfortable, but my kid doesn't seem to mind so far. Other than that it's incredible.
customer_reviews.author: JT Merillin

customer_reviews.title: Light
customer_reviews.text: Very light has space inside but it started giving problems to close up early on so we sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: zela4Eva

customer_reviews.title: I like it just fine!
customer_reviews.text: It’s compact enough to fit in my small trunk, it has 2 cup holders for the driver (& a place for my phone) and a cup holder for the child. I’m a grandmother it is a perfect stroller for us to go for walks or shopping in. It’s pretty simple to fold and unfold. My grand dog likes to hitch a ride when he gets tired, and there’s plenty room in the basket. You do have some assembly, but it was simple enough.
customer_reviews.author: TRexgirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! It is the perfect cross between light weight umbrella stroller and full size stroller. It is tall enough to keep from stooping and has a decent sized basket. The shade is actually pretty good at covering the baby, unlike many umbrella strollers. All of that is important, but add in the fact that it doesn't weigh a ton, and it's a winner. We got it for a Disney trip when we left our other decent umbrella at home. I was upset at first with spending the money, but I use this on all them time now. Opening and closing is really easy with it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Swparker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and must must have!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this sooner! As soon as I got it out of the box my 1 yr old insisted she sit in it. And once I got it together, which was pretty easy, we had to test it out for about 20 mins through the house. My daughter loves riding in it. I love that I can open and close it with one hand. Only thing I wish was different is the cupholders, I wish they were bigger. I have yet to find a cup that fits.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller because I wanted a cheap stroller that my 3 year old could fit in without having to carry him on vacations and chase after him. This stroller was PERFECT! My husband even bragged on it while on vacation. It's super easy to maneuver, very light weight, smooth when pushing, and leans back just enough where he could comfortably take a nap and we could store his diaper bag and shopping bags in the bottom. I would highly recommend it to anyone (actually I already have to two friends)!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read before you buy!!
customer_reviews.text: There are better options out there... For a lot more money!! This is more than you could ask for at this price range! It has a tray up top for keys and little stuff as well as two bottles and it also has a little eating tray so my baby can now eat no matter where we are. This is easier to fold than any other stroller I have used(can fold and open one handed). This is light weight and maneuvers very well. You will not be disappointed. It even have a little area on the bottom for extra goodies or diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great for me! Folds up easily and fits in my truck. It also unfolds easily and is light to lift. I highly recommend for toddlers. The seat doesn't lay flat like most popular strollers but it does lay semi so come naptime, they will lay comfortably. The straps are sturdy and help keep child in stroller. It's easy to maneuver and drive on concrete and asphlat. Not so good in grass or beachy sand. The wheels won't rotate and it gets stuck. But drives nice on flat surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Seat position sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Overall we like this stroller, it is light weight, folds up compactly (although the lock doesn't close when folded all the way), was easy to assemble and provides the convenience of two trays. However, the reclining seat is the biggest drawback for us. When placed in the "upright" position it is not really upright at all and my daughter (18 mo) is always slouching and sliding out of the seat, even with the belt on. She just looks uncomfortable. I think she likes to sit up straight and this does not allow a child to easily sit up straight. Its a bummer and will probably only use it when we really need a light weight option.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Katherine Mawyer

customer_reviews.title: Cupholders are useless
customer_reviews.text: Great product, however I bought BC of the cup holders, but they are practically useless. They are super small and won't even hold a standard soda bottle. It may can fit a bottle of water but that's about it. Not even a child's sippy cup can fit in there. Very disappointing. Other than that I like it. Update: still don't like it. It rides smooth, but the sun shade is useless also. Sun still gets in my son's eyes. He is 1. Wish I hadn't wasted money in this.
customer_reviews.author: Tabby

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I honestly bought this for the reviews and I was very disappointed. It is cheaply made and not well made. The seat back doesn’t recline much and the sunshade should be longer. The clips to strap in are cheap and very hard to use if you have any hand or joint issues. Unfortunately I waited too long to return this and now I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Do it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best money ever spent! I was looking for a small stroller with all of the important features for my 11 month old to travel to California (snack tray, storage underneath, recline, good sunshade). I love it so much and I can't believe how compact and light it is. I think I'm most excited to take my huge stroller out of my car and replace it with this tiny one! I almost bought another for my stroller loving 4 year old....he's easier though so I will just use another stroller I have with no frills for the long walking airports part. :) I am one very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Shara Cehak

customer_reviews.title: A few design flaws, but would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great small stroller for the price. Cons: The seat seems a little flimsy. The way you lower and raise it is just with a strap. The canopy covers the drink holder when it’s back. The basket underneath is TINY. I can’t get the diaper bag under the stroller at all. And there’s no good place to hang the diaper bag where it won’t tip the stroller over. Pros: I like the tray. It’s light, easy to fold, and fairly easy to put together. It seems comfortable (my baby always seems happy about riding in it). It’s a great small stroller for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Wrong seat angle, a child slides off the stroller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller because of othed reviews and light weight. With 5 children I had many different strollers, that were great, good and not good. This one is not good. A. It doesn't fold easily. B. When it is folded it's wide and takes more space than umbrella stroller, C. The main concern: the seat has a slope and my child needs to support her with legs not to slide off the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Anasko

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing! Purchase this since it was reviewed to be light weight. That is all it is! A bad product which is not easy to fold and definitely not easy to maneuver! I would not recommend this product! Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great stroller for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: easy to build, light weight, easy to steer, great price (especially on Prime Day). 10mo old seemed to enjoy the ride. Cons: wish the canopy was a little longer to block sun from her face, canopy peek mesh doesn't have a cover, canopy can't be removed, I found it really hard to loosen the waist buckles. Hard wheels are ok for our walks (she's ok feeling bumps) , but others might need air wheels for different terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I needed to purchase a lightweight stroller for quick walks around the neighborhood with my grandson. I didn't want something too expensive because my grandson comes over for a visit about once or twice a week. I was very pleased with this stroller. It is lightweight, has great maneuverability and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight stroller for occassional use
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight stroller. It handles well one- handed and is great in tight or crowded spaces. It also opens and closes easily. I bought this to keep in my car instead of the full-size stroller that came with my travel system and use it mainly for shopping and quick outings with either my 3 y/o or 7 m/o. I wouldn't say it is durable enough for daily use and would opt for the full size stroller for walks through the neighborhood or the park to ensure baby's comfort. However, it's perfect for my needs as it offers better control and more options than an umbrella stroller and is much more compact and portable than a full size stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick trips with older baby
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use while keeping new grand baby. It takes some assembly but nothing too difficult. It’s not hard to close but I certainly can’t close it with one hand as advertised. I’m most disappointed that it doesn’t recline anywhere near flat. I’m not sure I will be able to comfortably use it until baby is able to sit up 😕 It is very light, easy to lift and load into the car. I think eventually it will be perfect for quick trips around town. For the money it will work fine!
customer_reviews.author: L. Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Very average but works well for parents on the go
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a price of junk, though I use this stroller often as it’s light and I can throw it in the trunk compared to the heavy massive jogger we have. The front wheels could very well fall off at any moment and must be closed multiple times before it locks because the front wheels and pack wheels compete for space when trying to lock in the folded position. Was Easy assemble, unfortunately seems cheaper than most things made by this brand
customer_reviews.author: Daddy, Mama, Mila, & Baby Jake

customer_reviews.title: It's a perfect size, easily folds, light weight, and has good storage space. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a travel stroller but it has really replaced our regular and umbrella stroller. It's a perfect size, easily folds, and really light weight! Plus it has a good amount of storage plus child and adult trays with cup holders. The only improvement we would make is stronger wheels and shocks so it can withstand tougher terrains. But even then it holds up pretty well. We bought it to take on a trip to Europe (worked great!) but now it is our primary stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased strictly for use at Disneyland. My toddler was comfortable, able to see everything and is compact enoughto fit in the trunk with all of our luggage. The only issue we had was the wheels aren't well made or maybe we received a defective one. The stoller did it's job for the year we spent traveling back and forth to Disneyland.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle H

customer_reviews.title: Also the seat angle was not comfortable for my baby
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to try to open and shut one handed. Also the seat angle was not comfortable for my baby, especially when we was not sitting independently, the way it was angled would slide him way down into the buckle. Even when he was older/ bigger it didn't work well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we like this stroller :) It worked well for the international travel and it is very light! However, I find it difficult (or not working at all) for one hand folding - I typically use my both hands to close it. Also, compare to our previous one, this stroller doesn't fold as compact - the height remain the same when u fold, which takes up our mini SUV's trunk in length. Altho I appreciate both kids' and adults' cup holders, they are too small for most of the bottles we have. However, we are happy with the purchase for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: The Reed

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the rain!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this stroller, and the reviews were great. However, the first time we used it, it was raining outside. We were at Disney, so it wasn't easily avoidable. The red color ran and stained my sons clothing. It was disappointing, and the clothing couldn't be saved. Other than that, the stroller is great.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: seat back not so great
customer_reviews.text: purchased this stroller to use for my great grandchild when I take him on walks. the stroller assembled well and seems to be quite sturdy. the back of the seat however is a disappointment. it is quite soft with no support in it. the description says multi positions but basically there are no "positions"...you have to adjust the straps at the level you want....nothing "clicks" into place,etc. I plan on keeping it and using it as soon as our weather breaks. hopefully the seat back will not be too much of a problem. I do think a better description of the seat back is needed or at least let possible customers know there is no real support and positioning there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't like how you cannot raise the handlebars on this stroller. I also find myself kicking the bar when I walk - The space underneath the stroller is pretty small and a standard plastic cup does not fit into the cupholder on top. Not my favorite stroller. I've used it a few times but think I am going to sell it and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Love this lightweight stroller. It was easy to assemble, it’s easy to push, and love the storage underneath the stroller. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight and easy to fold. I love the canopy on it. It is pretty flimsy. I've purchased much less expensive strollers and they were much steadier. I am short so height not a problem but I can see why people complain who are taller as it is very short and it would be difficult if you wanted to walk fast or run pushing the stroller if you are tall.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Hey Mom - you need this
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic in my household. Ever since my son was 3 months old we've been able to use this product. It's lightweight and easy to throw in the car. It sometimes takes a little extra "oomph" to fold it up, but overall I really can't complain. The price, the use, it's a basic necessity. For all parents out there on the run with other kids, this is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Dani E.

customer_reviews.title: ❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.text: As a first time mom, I just needed something comfortable for her, easy to put together and ready to move. Not gonna take too much space in my car, even though it’s a 7 seated SUV because I hate my car being all cramped and loaded. Got this and it took me less than 20mins to put together. Very light weight and works perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: joyz

customer_reviews.title: Not good for taller babies/toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Stroller was easy to assemble. Nice color (red) unfortunately the material is on the cheap side. I guess this stroller is just for emergency’s or short trips. Not ideal for tall babies. My daughter is tall and her feet almost touch the ground. I decided to only use this stroller on short trips. I guess you get what you pay for with this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight. Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Used this on all our European travels with cobblestone everywhere and this lil guy has kept up! Cant believe how light it is. Love the cup holder (for us, it holds our son's treats). Wish the bottom was bigger, but thats just because we have a HUGE diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N.

customer_reviews.title: Win/win situation
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe how easy this was to set up. Wow. It makes life a lot easier as well. You can push it so easy without killing your self like you do with some strollers. This was a great price when we bought it. My granddaughter loves it so it’s a win/win situation. It’s a lightweight stroller but has the ability of a big stroller to go anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L Christian

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how this would hold up for everyday use, but I bought this for my granddaughter when she came over. It is lightweight and easy to fold and maneuver. I would recommend for grandparents like myself that may use it once a week or so. I gave it four stars because the cup holders are small, especially one for adult cups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but I don’t like how my two year old can’t sit up straight and he is constantly taking off the back caps on the wheels also when I unbuckled him he slid out the bottom ... wouldn’t recommend to anyone only thing I love is it has more sun coverage than most strollers
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to fold. But the baby MUST be able to sit up by him-or herself and it does NOT recline completely. Overall a good stroller especially for my new reborn baby boy doll, also purchased on Amazon! He is from the Kiki Doll Collection with a red hoodie, red plaid pants, a grey hat and white sneakers. He has blonde hair and blue eyes and is 22 inches long.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am very please with this purchase I is easy to maneuver even on very thick grass. It folds easily and is light weight. I was concerned that my 6 foot 2 husband would find the handles too short to push but they are fine. Might not work for someone taller. There's one improvement that would be helpful and that is if the seating material were not slick causing the child to slide down against the strap. Over all I think this is a very good buy..
customer_reviews.author: Keyboard Shoper

customer_reviews.title: Light, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very light and made it through a 10 day trip to Disney World. It is not very balanced so you can't hang anything on the handle bars unless there is a kid sitting in it. The wheels are also not the best for bumpy terrain. Overall it served it's purpose. It's a good stroller to fold and carry on a bus several times a day, but it's not high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Ann

customer_reviews.title: NO FOOTREST.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I was disappointed in is the footrest. There isn’t one. So, if your baby is lying back (not very far but I knew that) the baby’s feet just hang down. There really isn’t very much depth to it. Our grandson is only 4 months old, and I wanted something lightweight that could stay in my car in order to pull out quickly to take him for a quick errand.
customer_reviews.author: Florance

customer_reviews.title: If your looking for a sturdy stroller this is not for you
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a sturdy stroller this is not for you! It is light weight, easy to push and the handle is very comfortable. The back is cardboard!!! Once child is buckled in it becomes part of his back, moving to and fro with the child. It is a tight fit, my grandson is an average sized 2 y/o and he just fits in it. My arthritic hands have difficulty folding it, but once folded it is very easy to pick up and put in trunk. My husband thinks its okay, but I do not like it.
customer_reviews.author: granz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travelling and just going for walks
customer_reviews.text: I am super happy with this stroller. Today so many people seem to want giant kiddie vehicles (why?), but I like this one because it is lightweight, carry-able (folds and unfolds well), and easily manueverable. My four-month-old grandson loves his walks in this stroller, and the price was right! If I had to add a con, it would be that there is not a ton of storage space. Nevertheless, for those looking for a lightweight stroller, I recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive stroller. .
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of shopping around before buying. This stroller is the best bang for your buck. My son is on the taller side for his age and it's a great fit for him. His last stroller didn't last long and he could touch the wheels with his feet. This sits far back enough that he is sits more comfortably and high enough. I am very happy with my purchase...... Update: I lowered my stars because the stroller is very sensitive over cracks or uneven surfaces. It's like a skateboard over cracks. It will jolt your kid forward over deep cracks and bumps. I have to stop a lean the stroller back to go over and uneven surface.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not worth any amount of your hard earned money
customer_reviews.text: Lightbweight but seat positioning isn't that great. Only for sometimes use. Not a every day stroller. After using this stroller more. I hate the seat positioning. My toddler never looks comfortable. Update: recently had stroller fold on my son unexpectedly. He didn't get hurt thankfully. This stroller isn't worth it. Please do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda l

customer_reviews.title: Too small for the purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bouht this for my 3 yr kid(average size) and it is too small to hold her. Her legs touches ground. Also the seat doesnt have enough space to hold a 3 yr kid. She slips off very easly. She is just fit on the cart. No room to keep her comfy. It doesnt folds completly. Most of the time the front wheels get jammed, prevents it from folding properly. Not a good purchase. Planing to return.
customer_reviews.author: tharun

customer_reviews.title: My daughter has worn out two so far, she loves it.
customer_reviews.text: It is awkward to move compared to the one I bought for my car for my granddaughter. My daughter loves it and uses it 4 days a week. Nice size basket for storage under the seat, weight is great, light... It also doesn't fold as easily as the one handed models but is nearly 25% less expensive so priorities matter.
customer_reviews.author: michelle moore

customer_reviews.title: easy fold, stands on its own
customer_reviews.text: Everything you want in a stroller...lightweight, food tray, cup holders (for mom, also!), easy fold, stands on its own, reclines enough for a nap, shade awning is big, shelf for stuff at bottom, rolls easily, one bar for pushing...LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Must Have inexpensive travel stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to take along on a two week trip to Hawaii. This stroller exceeded my expectations. It traveled SO well! Cupholders and space underneath were huge traveling through a large airport. It folded up pretty small to fit nicely in our rental car. It made walking along cement bike paths a breeze and even my 7 year old could push her 3 year old 34 pound brother with ease. While loaded down it was still able to maneuver through rough terrain and grass with two hands. If you are like me and don't want to travel with a big bulky BOB, BUY THIS STROLLER!!
customer_reviews.author: Ambre Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller for me as a grandma watching my granddaughter as it's super easy to open and close and lightweight. It would make a great travel stroller too if it can withstand the potential rough handling at the airport but it's so lightweight and still has the trays and basket necessary for the parent and child. It's not heavy duty but that's not what they are claiming it is...so it's exactly what I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: cdubbs

product_meta.title: Kolcraft Cloud Plus Lightweight Easy Fold Compact Travel Stroller, Fire Red
product_meta.description:
Color:Fire RedThis Kolcraft lightweight stroller is designed for the family on the go. (only 11.8lbs!) Perfect for traveling and day trips with a convenient one-hand compact fold and multi-position reclining seat. Large, easy-access storage basket for all of baby’s necessities and child tray for baby’s enjoyment. Three-tier, extended canopy for maximum sun coverage and peek-a-boo window keep child protected and all-terrain wheels and front suspension make for a smooth ride. Includes adjustable 5-point safety harness. One-Year Manufacturer Warranty. Maximum Weight: 50 lbs. JPMA Certified. Disney Size Approved!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Kolcraft is a third generation family-owned American Manufacturer of baby products specializing in top-rated crib mattresses, nursery furniture, family-friendly strollers and other dependable products for your baby. As the manufacturer, we stand behind all our products with great customer service and support. If there is anything we can do to help you, please let us know.
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT -- Travel friendly lightweight design (only 11.8 lbs), perfect for traveling and day trips. Disney Size Approved!The assembled dimensions are 17.6 x 29.9 x 41.7 inches
EXTENDED CANOPY -- Three-tier, extended canopy for maximum UV protection. A peek-a-boo window so you can easily keep a watchful eye on your baby.

EASY ONE-HAND FOLD -- Convenient one-hand and self-standing fold, perfect for car travel and vacations. Folded Dimensions: 18" W x 12" d x 34" h. All-terrain wheels and front suspension for a smooth ride
RECLINING SEAT -- Reclining seat offers 5-point safety restraint system and accommodates child up to 40 pounds and 40 inches tall. (Seat does not recline completely flat)

ROOMY STORAGE -- Large, easy to access storage basket holds all baby's necessities. Removable child tray with dual cup & juice box holder, and parent tray with two water bottle holders and extra storage area.
RECOMMENDED USE -- The Kolcraft Cloud Plus Lightweight Stroller can be used when the child has full head and neck control and can sit up unassisted. Does not accommodate car seat.
MANUFACTURER NOTE -- As the manufacturer, Kolcraft stands behind all our products with great customer service and support. If there is anything we can do to help you, please let us know.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,381 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
